components.description:
A goat, a sturdy, hoofed animal raised for its meat and milk. Depicted as a light brown, white, or multicored goat in full profile on all fours facing left, a scraggly beard, upright tail, and brown or yellow horns curving back.

Frequently used as a visual shorthand for the slang expression GOAT, or the Great of All Time, often said of athletes and in particular the late Kobe Bryant.

Often considered one of the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac. Also often used to represent ‚ôë Capricorn in the Western zodiac.

Apple, Google, and Samsung’s goats were previously white, as a Saanen goat. Facebook’s design previously featured only a goat face.
components.title: Goat

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A goat, displayed in white, gray, or brown depending on platform.¬† Previously appeared as a Saanen goat on iOS, but changed to a Toggenberg  http://emojipedia.org/goat/
emoji_net_data.name: goat

bn:00015707n: One of the constellations of the zodiac
A faint zodiacal constellation in the southern hemisphere; between Sagittarius and Aquarius
One of the twelve constellations of the zodiac.
Capricornus is one of the constellations of the zodiac; it is often called Capricorn, especially when referring to the corresponding astrological sign.
Capricorn is the tenth astrological sign in the zodiac, originating from the constellation of Capricornus.

bn:00015720n: A goat is a bovine famous for its ability to forage on plants unpalatable, and in habitats inaccessible, to other browsers.
Any of numerous agile ruminants related to sheep but having a beard and straight horns
A common four-legged animal (Capra) that is related to sheep and bred by humans for its coat and milk.
Domesticated mammal raised primarily for its milk
The domestic goat is a subspecies of goat domesticated from the wild goat of southwest Asia and Eastern Europe.
